author: Max DELANY
title: 'Worth the wait': Swedish troops relish NATO leap | Latest News
text:
Swedish marines on Friday peered out from their assault vessel as part of a vast NATO military exercise to simulate repelling an invasion of neighbouring Norway.
After a ceremony in Washington less than 24 hours earlier, the troops marked their country's first full day as a member of the US-led alliance after two centuries of non-alignment.

author: Caracol TelevisiÃ³n
title: Esta es la broma que se hizo viral en el DÃ­a de los Inocentes: "MamÃ¡, este seÃ±or me estÃ¡ llamando" - CaracolTV
text: Una broma de TikTok se volviÃ³ viral entre los jÃ³venes en el [DÃ­a de los Inocentes](https://www.caracoltv.com/contenido/dia-de-los-inocentes) La travesura consiste en utilizar un filtro que simula una videollamada con la imagen de un hombre desconocido en primer plano con los grÃ¡ficos correspondientes. El objetivo principal es engaÃ±ar a sus familiares, haciÃ©ndoles creer que estÃ¡n teniendo una conversaciÃ³n con un extraÃ±o a altas horas de la noche. Mira tambiÃ©n: [Â¡CaÃ­ste por inocente! Jurados y presentadores revelan las bromas de las que han sido vÃ­ctimas.](https://www.caracoltv.com/yo-me-llamo/exclusivos-web/caiste-por-inocente-jurados-y-presentadores-revelan-las-bromas-de-las-que-han-sido-victimas) Los videos, que capturan la reacciÃ³n en tiempo real de las "vÃ­ctimas", se han vuelto virales gracias a las expresiones sorprendidas, asustadas y cÃ³micas de quienes caen en la broma. Una usuaria le dice a su progenitora: "De noche me estÃ¡ llamando un tipo, yo no sÃ© quiÃ©n es, le contestÃ© y se queda ahÃ­". La mujer, visiblemente preocupada, voltea a la cÃ¡mara y pregunta quiÃ©n es esa persona. La joven, manteniendo la farsa, responde: "No sÃ©, un seÃ±or que me llama". La seÃ±ora, entre risas y temores, le ordena a su hija terminar la llamada y alejarse del misterioso hombre. Publicidad Publicidad Lo que hizo viral a esta broma es la combinaciÃ³n de la tecnologÃ­a, la sorpresa genuina de las "vÃ­ctimas" y la creatividad. La tensiÃ³n aumenta cuando las mamÃ¡s, en su afÃ¡n de proteger a sus hijos, entran en modo defensivo y expresan su preocupaciÃ³n de una manera cÃ³mica y autÃ©ntica. Las reacciones han generado millones de reproducciones y han convertido este trend en un fenÃ³meno digno de explorar. MÃ¡s allÃ¡ de las risas y el entretenimiento, esta broma refleja el espÃ­ritu del DÃ­a de los Inocentes en las redes sociales, para generar divertidos momentos. AdemÃ¡s, conecta a personas de todo el mundo a travÃ©s de tendencias. TikTok se ha convertido en un escenario donde la creatividad florece en estas festividades, y esta travesura es un ejemplo perfecto de ello. Te puede interesar: [La Liendra le jugÃ³ divertida broma a un hombre que lo confundiÃ³ con J Balvin.](https://www.caracoltv.com/regias/famosos/la-liendra-le-jugo-divertida-broma-a-un-hombre-que-lo-confundio-con-j-balvin) Publicidad Â¿QuÃ© esperas para hacer esta divertida broma y disfrutar de las reacciones mÃ¡s inesperadas?, te dejamos algunos de los videos mÃ¡s virales que te harÃ¡n reÃ­r con este fenÃ³meno de TikTok que ha asustado a mÃ¡s de una madre. [@crisorroche] Le hago la broma dem seÃ±or a mi madre y esta es su reacciÃ³nðŸ˜‚!!! author: Nicole Wells
title: Paul Whelan 'Extremely Concerned About Being Left Behind' Again
text: By Nicole Wells | 05:30 PM EST American Paul Whelan said he is "extremely concerned about being left behind" in Russia again, as the Biden administration looks to cut a deal with the Kremlin to release U.S. detainees. In one of several phone calls over the Christmas holiday, Whelan told WTOP that the Russians are "adamant" about doing "one-for-one exchanges," which he worries will result in Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich's release and not his own. "At this point, the five-year mark, I'm extremely concerned about being left behind a third time," Whelan said. "I'm concerned that the Biden administration will work out a deal for Evan to be returned home, leaving me here a third time." Whelan, a former Marine who was working as a security guard when he was arrested in 2018, said Moscow's "false narrative" that he is a "brigadier general and a secret agent" sent to Russia "on a secret mission" isn't helping matters. "They want an assassin for me," he told WTOP. "It's ridiculous that we've gotten to this point in hostage situations." Last week, Whelan said he felt abandoned by the Biden administration and called the White House's failure to secure his freedom a "serious betrayal." If Gershkovich is released before him, Whelan said, "it could significantly limit the options they have for my future release." Russian President Vladimir Putin said earlier this month that Moscow is working to arrange a prisoner swap that would include both Whelan and Gershkovich. The State Department said a couple weeks ago, however, that Russia rejected a "significant proposal" to secure the release of both imprisoned Americans. The White House responded to WTOP's request for comment with a statement from the National Security Council. "In the cases of Paul Whelan and Evan Gershkovich, we have made and will continue to make significant offers for them, including one earlier this month," NSC spokesperson Adrienne Watson said. "We also continue our conversations with third party countries as we work to find a way to secure their release." Whelan said the longer the prisoner exchange discussions "are allowed to go on, the more complicated and harder it is for them to be resolved." Sentenced to 16 years in prison for espionage, Whelan has denied the charges as has the U.S. Under the Biden administration, he was left out of two prisoner swaps between Washington and Moscow, with the U.S. bringing home Marine veteran Trevor Reed in April 2022 and WNBA player Brittney Griner later that year. Reed was traded for a Russian convicted on drug charges and Griner was exchanged for convicted Russian arms dealer Viktor Bout. Nicole Wells, a Newsmax general assignment reporter covers news, politics, and culture. She is a National Newspaper Association award-winning journalist. Â© 2023 Newsmax.

author: Karol Lopez
title: Hidroituango: el MEGAPROYECTO hidroelÃ©ctrico mÃ¡s grande de Colombia financiado por el BID destaca por innovar en la generaciÃ³n de energÃ­a y evitar un apagÃ³n nacional | Mundo | La RepÃºblica
text: Hidroituango: el MEGAPROYECTO hidroelÃ©ctrico mÃ¡s grande de Colombia financiado por el BID destaca por innovar en la generaciÃ³n de energÃ­a y evitar un apagÃ³n nacional Gracias al respaldo financiero del Banco Interamericano de Desarrollo, Hidroituango avanza a pesar de desafÃ­os como deslizamientos e inundaciones y promete empleos y crecimiento econÃ³mico. Hidroituango es el proyecto hidroelÃ©ctrico mÃ¡s grande de [Colombia](https://larepublica.pe/datos-lr/colombia/2024/09/27/estos-cinco-platos-colombianos-son-mas-saludables-de-lo-que-pensabas-mira-cuales-son-los-ingredientes-para-prepararlos-lrtmco-1638702) y uno de los mÃ¡s destacados de [AmÃ©rica Latina](https://larepublica.pe/tag/america-latina). Aparte de ser un hito en infraestructura, ha superado mÃºltiples desafÃ­os a lo largo de su desarrollo. La obra promete garantizar la estabilidad energÃ©tica y evitar apagones masivos. Con una capacidad proyectada de 2.400 megavatios (MW), este megaproyecto tiene como objetivo cubrir cerca del 17% de la demanda energÃ©tica de todo el paÃ­s, detalla John Maya Salazar, gerente de Empresas PÃºblicas de MedellÃ­n (EPM). A continuaciÃ³n, exploramos los aspectos clave de Hidroituango, su impacto y el futuro que promete para la estabilidad energÃ©tica del paÃ­s cafetero. PUEDES VER: [Un paÃ­s de SudamÃ©rica entre los 10 mÃ¡s poblados del mundo, con mÃ¡s de 200 millones de personas: supera a Rusia] Â¿QuÃ© es Hidroituango y cuÃ¡l es su importancia? Ubicado en el departamento de [Antioquia](https://larepublica.pe/mundo/colombia/2024/07/14/estas-regiones-en-colombia-son-las-lideres-del-sector-turistico-antioquia-con-cifras-record-es-la-numero-uno-lrtmco-123852), Hidroituango ha sido concebido como una de las soluciones mÃ¡s grandes y avanzadas para la generaciÃ³n de energÃ­a limpia en Colombia. Con una extensiÃ³n que abarca mÃ¡s de 79 kilÃ³metros cuadrados, su construcciÃ³n ha sido uno de los proyectos mÃ¡s ambiciosos del paÃ­s. Financiado en parte por el Banco Interamericano de Desarrollo (BID), Hidroituango tiene como misiÃ³n principal garantizar el suministro de energÃ­a elÃ©ctrica en Colombia, evitando apagones masivos que afectarÃ­an a millones de hogares y empresas en todo el territorio. Hidroituango contribuirÃ¡ de manera significativa al crecimiento econÃ³mico de la regiÃ³n. Foto: Hidroituango.com.co El BID ha sido un aliado crucial para la realizaciÃ³n de este proyecto. Su respaldo financiero ha permitido que Hidroituango siga avanzando a pesar de los problemas y retos que han surgido durante su ejecuciÃ³n, como deslizamientos de tierra, inundaciones y la necesidad de reubicar comunidades aledaÃ±as. Su participaciÃ³n ha sido fundamental para garantizar que el proyecto no se detenga. Â¿CÃ³mo va Hidroituango? Avances actuales Actualmente, el proyecto Hidroituango se encuentra operando al 50% de su capacidad, con dos de sus ocho unidades generadoras en funcionamiento. Este avance ha sido vital para evitar un apagÃ³n a nivel nacional, tras proporcionar un porcentaje significativo de la electricidad que requiere el paÃ­s. Se espera que para 2027, Hidroituango estÃ© operando a plena capacidad, lo que permitirÃ¡ un suministro elÃ©ctrico mÃ¡s seguro y confiable. De este modo, Colombia podrÃ­a enfrentar mejor los desafÃ­os energÃ©ticos futuros. PUEDES VER: [Las Ãºnicas universidades de AmÃ©rica Latina en el ranking mundial de MBA 2025 de QS: superan a varias de EE. UU.] Una de las caracterÃ­sticas mÃ¡s destacadas de Hidroituango es su enfoque en la innovaciÃ³n tecnolÃ³gica. El proyecto ha implementado sistemas avanzados de generaciÃ³n hidroelÃ©ctrica, buscando maximizar la eficiencia energÃ©tica mientras se minimiza el impacto ambiental. Esta combinaciÃ³n de alta tecnologÃ­a y sostenibilidad convierte a Hidroituango en un referente dentro del sector energÃ©tico en AmÃ©rica Latina, especialmente en tÃ©rminos de producciÃ³n de energÃ­a renovable. Retos y beneficios del megaproyecto A pesar de los avances, Hidroituango tuvo que enfrentar mÃºltiples retos. Desde problemas tÃ©cnicos hasta conflictos sociales relacionados con el reasentamiento de comunidades, el proyecto ha sido objeto de crÃ­ticas. Sin embargo, los beneficios que promete superarÃ­an los desafÃ­os iniciales. Se estima que el proyecto generarÃ¡ miles de empleos directos e indirectos, y contribuirÃ¡ de manera significativa al crecimiento econÃ³mico de la regiÃ³n y del paÃ­s. A medida que Hidroituango avanza hacia su plena operaciÃ³n, las expectativas son altas. Este megaproyecto no solo garantiza la estabilidad energÃ©tica de Colombia, sino que tambiÃ©n tiene el potencial de posicionar al paÃ­s como un lÃ­der en la generaciÃ³n de energÃ­a renovable en la regiÃ³n. AdemÃ¡s, el impacto positivo en la reducciÃ³n de emisiones de gases de efecto invernadero refuerza su importancia en la lucha contra el cambio climÃ¡tico, un compromiso que Colombia ha asumido en su agenda ambiental.

author: yahoo
title: I Shop for a Living, and These 16 Style and Home Finds Were the Best I Tested in 2023
text:
Shopping I Tested 250+ Products This Year, and These Were My 16 Favorites in 2023 Ahem, youâ€™re welcome.
By Wendy Vazquez Wendy Vazquez Wendy is a home commerce writer covering trends, news, and deals for Real Simple, Better Homes & Gardens, and Southern Living. Real Simple's Editorial Guidelines Published on December 28, 2023 03:00PM EST We independently evaluate all recommended products and services. If you click on links we provide, we may receive compensation. Learn more .
Photo: Real Simple / Tyler Roeland
2023 was quite a year for unforgettable launches that thrilled me and served me well. After testing over 250 fashion, beauty, and home products this year, there were a handful that stood out to me.
As a shopping writer, plenty of items make their way across my desk, from trendy new beauty staples to multitasking small appliances. I took the time to return to my haul and highlight the items that made the biggest impact on me this past year. Below is a thoughtfully curated list of 16 products I'd add to my cart all over again.
16 Shopping Writer-Loved Finds From 2023 Our Place Always Pan 2.0 , $105 (was $150); fromourplace.com . Ninja 12-in-1 Smart Double Oven , $250 (was $350); amazon.com . Shinery Radiance Wash Jewelry Cleaner and Brush Duo , $45 (was $56); amazon.com . Shark FlexStyle Air Styling & Drying System , $250 (was $300); sharkclean.com . Lalais the Blotting Compact , $48; lalais.com . Urban Decay Vice Lip Bond Glossy Liquid Lipstick , $27; sephora.com . Gatherall Bra , $68; wegatherall.com . Vegamour Hydr-8 Leave-In Conditioner , $34; vegamour.com . Conair Power Steam Garment Steamer , $43; amazon.com . iWooly Cordless Vacuum Cleaner , $80 (was $150); amazon.com . Luxome Ultra Plush Throw , $135; luxome.com . Pyrex Deep Glass Baking Dish , $16; amazon.com . Journee Collection Zina Shoe , $70; journeecollection.com . Hanhoo Blemish Patch Discovery Kit , $25; amazon.com . Uniqlo HeatTech Crew Mellow Sock , $8; uniqlo.com . Innbeauty Project Slushy Serum Moisturizer , $30; innbeautyproject.com . Pyrex Deep Glass Baking Dish Amazon
Buy on Amazon $16 I bought a few of these as backups for Thanksgiving, but their deep design and snug lid made me toss my other shallow glass baking dishes. I'll make a large casserole and conveniently save the leftovers for lunch without wasting plastic wrap or tin foil. Anytime I bring it to a potluck, people always ask me where I bought it.
Journee Collection Zina Shoe Journee Collection
Buy on Journeecollection.com $70 When it comes to shoes, I like to stick to a few dependable options to get me through a season. The Zina from the Journee Collection is the perfect mix of classic Oxford style with an edgy twist because of its lug sole and fun patent leather finish. They are a surprisingly lightweight pair that require no break-in period.
Hanhoo Blemish Patch Discovery Kit Amazon
Buy on Amazon $25 I'm obsessed with hydrocolloid patches, and Hanhoo's seven-piece collection has a patch for just about every blemish situation. Whether I'm dealing with body acne, a gunk-filled T-zone, or dark spots, there is always an option to suit my needs. It's like the perfect first-aid kit for zits.
Uniqlo HeatTech Crew Mellow Sock Uniqlo
Buy on Uniqlo.com $8 My feet run cold, whether they're in shearling lined boots or a sleek pair of sneakers. I love how thin yet incredibly warm these Uniqlo socks feel. According to the brand, its proprietary HeatTech technology locks in heat while also controlling odors.
Innbeauty Project Slushy Serum Moisturizer Innbeauty Project
Buy on Innbeautyproject.com $30 It was love at first touch with the Slushy Serum Moisturizer. After hearing everyone rave about this formula, I finally decided to give it a shot, and I wasn't disappointed. The gel texture is surprisingly hydrating and boasts smoothing bakuchiol, brightening yuzu, and plumping hyaluronic acid that feels like a slushy for your face.
Our Place Always Pan 2.0 Our Place
Buy on Fromourplace.com $150 $105 In May, two other shopping writers and I tested the new Always Pan 2.0 from one of my favorite cookware brands, Our Place. I'm happy to report that it still holds up. This little guy lives on my stove and is probably the most-used piece of cooking equipment I own. The nesting spatula feature has also been a game changer.
Ninja 12-in-1 Smart Double Oven Amazon
Buy on Amazon $350 $250 I can honestly say that I can't remember the last time we used our oven thanks to this do-it-all gadget that bears the brunt of most of my lunches and dinners. I love making multiple dishes at once in this thing due to all of the cooking functions, and it's one of the easiest appliances to useâ€”even my husband and father-in-law sing its praises whenever it's their turn to make a meal.
Shinery Radiance Wash Jewelry Cleaner and Brush Duo Amazon
Buy on Amazon $56 $45 I have to admit that I never owned a nice piece of jewelry before my engagement ring and wedding band. I couldn't believe how easy it was to get them to shine like new using this cleaner and brush kit. Anytime they start to look dull, I'll just whip this out, and they're clean in minutes with minimal effort.
Shark FlexStyle Air Styling & Drying System Shark
Buy on Sharkclean.com $300 $250 What was I even doing before the Shark FlexStyle came into my life? Whether I'm going for frizz-free curls or a voluminous blowout, I only need this tool to get it done. The new FrizzFighter Finishing Tool has helped me smooth out my tresses quickly. It's so indispensable to me that I won't travel without itâ€”I make room in whatever luggage I'm using.
Lalais the Blotting Compact Lalais
Buy on Lalais.com $48 I discovered this generously sized blotting compact thanks to Oprah, who put it on her Favorite Things list this year. The packaging feels so luxe that I have no qualms about whipping it out in the middle of dinner to degrease my T-zone with just a couple of swift pats. This mirror is also the perfect size for on-the-go touchups.
Urban Decay Vice Lip Bond Glossy Liquid Lipstick Sephora
Buy on Sephora $27 Finally, a long-lasting lip color that doesn't make my lips feel like the Sahara desert after an hour. "Test Em" is the loveliest dusty rose shade that looks gorgeous with bold, neutral, or minimal makeup looks. However, if you're ready to get dramatic, "Once Strangers" is the it color of winter.
Gatherall Bra Gatherall
Buy on Wegatherall.com $68 If you're anything like me and absolutely detest the idea of even putting a bra on for a few hours, you need to try this Gatherall strapless bra. It's the first adhesive silicone bra Iâ€™ve tried that hasn't been overly obvious thanks to its super slim design, and it's even sweatproof. Plus, it's super easy to care for.
Vegamour Hydr-8 Leave-In Conditioner Vegamour
Buy Now $34 Since its launch earlier this year, Vegamour's silky Hydr-8 Leave-In Conditioner has had me in a serious chokehold. I've tried so many different leave-in conditioners, but I always come back to this one because it's one of the few that leave my waves silky and soft without ever weighing them down with product.
Conair Power Steam Garment Steamer Amazon
Buy on Amazon $43 Whipping out the iron and folding table is a laborious affair that I'd prefer not to do, but I also hate walking around with wrinkled clothing. This travel-friendly steamer heats up in just 35 seconds and gets the job done in no time. You can even switch between 120 and 240 voltages.
iWooly Cordless Vacuum Cleaner Amazon
Buy on Amazon $150 $80 Our first floor is covered in all tile and hardwood flooring. Combine that with our 3-year-old husky, and we've got nothing but tumbleweeds of furâ€”that is until we got this vacuum. Due to its lightweight and robust design, we can do swift daily sweeps to effortlessly collect all the dust and dog hair.
Luxome Ultra Plush Throw Luxome
Buy on Luxome.com $135 Apparently, I knew nothing about peak coziness until I got my hands on this ridiculously soft and cushy throw blanket. The viscose and bamboo blend feels incredible on my skin and keeps me warm on movie nights. As a matter of fact, this is one of the few items in my house that I refuse to share.

author: time news
title: Israel killed dozens of Palestinians in Gaza, including in the depopulated north - timenews
text: 2023-12-28 23:40:00 Health Ministry spokesman Ashraf al Qudra said â€œthe number of victims was likely to increaseâ€ / Photo: AFP. This Thursday, Israeli forces bombed cities and refugee camps from the north to the south of the Gaza Strip and killed dozens of Palestinians, with Israel determined to redouble an almost three-month offensive against the Islamist Hamas movement that has expanded to almost the entire territory and displaced several thousand civilians, amid new UN warnings over the humanitarian crisis in the enclave. The conflict has already left more than 21,000 Palestinians dead and expelled about 85% of the 2.3 million inhabitants of their homes from their homes. Gaza. Much of the north of the territory was devastated by aerial bombardments and urban fighting, and has been largely depopulated and isolated from the rest for weeks. [#Gaza]People forced to move once again. More people in less space. Rafah in the south is now bursting at the seams. No respite. Time for a humanitarian [#ceasefire] [@UNRWA] [pic.twitter.com/sC9lhYRjq7] â€” Thomas White (@TomWhiteGaza) [December 26, 2023] Israel said this week that will expand its combined air and ground offensive to a third sector, the center of the Gaza Stripafter attacking refugee camps there by air and bringing troops and tanks closer to them, after opening a second front of combat in the southern city of Khan Yunis at the beginning of December. In the umpteenth international warning about the situation in Gaza, the UN agency for Palestinian refugees (UNRWA) said this Thursday that civilians in the region â€œThey are dealing with catastrophic hunger.â€ due to the lack of food as a result of Israel closing all its borders. â€œEvery day is a fight for survival, to find food and water,â€ he said. Thomas White, UNRWA Gaza Affairs Directoron social network X, and added that â€œ40% of the population is already at risk of suffering from famine.â€ Israel has promised to dismantle Hamas to prevent it from launching attacks again like those on October 7, when militants from the group infiltrated from Gaza killed some 1,200 people, mostly civilians, and kidnapped another 240, including about twenty Argentines. Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahuhas rejected international calls for a ceasefire, believing this would be a â€œgiftâ€ to Hamas and instead vowed to intensify the offensive until the group is destroyed and the hostages still held captive are recovered. after 105 were released last month during a truce. The Security Council approves a resolution demanding the delivery of immediate and safe humanitarian aid in Gaza, as well as the creation of conditions for the sustainable cessation of hostilities. [pic.twitter.com/NkDwAsgQZy] â€” United Nations (@ONU_es) [December 22, 2023] The United States provided crucial political and military support on the offensive and, although he has also urged Israel to reduce civilian casualties and allow more aid into Gaza, the situation on the ground has not changed much, even after the UN Security Council passed a resolution who asked for the same thing last week. READ Also: Images after the invasion of January 8 reveal Lula's anger and security failures - 04/24/2023 - Brazil In that context, however, Hamas announced today that it will send a delegation to Egypt tomorrow to share its â€œobservationsâ€ on an Egyptian plan for a ceasefire. â€œA high-level delegation from the Hamas political bureau (based in Qatar) will travel to Cairo this Friday to meet with Egyptian officials and convey to them the response of the Palestinian factions, which includes several observations, to their plan,â€ declared a Hamas officialwho spoke on condition of anonymity, according to the AFP news agency. The plan in question was presented last week to the leaders of Hamas and Islamic Jihad, which is also involved in the fighting against Israeli troops in the Gaza Strip, during visits to Cairo by the leaders of both movements. In Gaza, meanwhile, an Israeli bombardment killed more than 30 people when it hit a square and surrounding houses in Beit Lahiya this Thursday.a city in the northern Strip that was one of the first targets of the ground offensive, in late October, the Palestinian news agency Wafa reported, citing medical sources. Two journalists were among the dead, the Hamas Government Press Office in Gaza said, adding that this brought to 105 the number of press workers who lost their lives in the offensive. In central Gaza, Israeli warplanes and artillery bombed the Bureij and Nuseirat refugee camps and leveled buildings, residents told Wafa. The agency said at least seven Palestinians were killed in an attack in Nuseirat. Photo: AFP Israel said this week it would expand its ground offensive into central Gaza and ordered the evacuation of an area there, which includes the Bureij camp, where tens of thousands of Palestinians fleeing from the north are taking refuge. Israel, which has asked civilians in that area to go to the nearby city of Deir el-Balah, typically launches airstrikes before troops and tanks arrive. Hamas said this week that it attacked an Israeli tank east of Bureij. Also there were airstrikes in Khan Yuniswhere at least one Palestinian was killed and several others were injured in the southeast of the city, Qatari television station Al Jazeera reported. Itâ€™s a statement, The Gaza Health Ministry said at least 50 Palestinians were killed on Thursday and dozens were injured. in Israeli morning attacks in Beit Lahiya, Khan Yunis and the Al Maghazi refugee camp, which is also in central Gaza, near Bureij and Deir el-Balah. The Israeli Army blames the high number of civilian deaths on Hamas, which positions fighters, tunnels and rocket launchers in residential areas Israelâ€™s offensive in Gaza is already one of the most devastating military campaigns in recent history. At least 21,320 Palestinians, most of them women and children, died in Israeli bombings or fighting in Gaza, including 220 in the last 24 hours, while another 55,603 were injured, the local Ministry of Health indicated today. The count does not differentiate between civilians and combatants. The Israeli Army claims it has killed thousands of Hamas militants and that 167 of its soldiers have died in the ground offensive. The conflict spread across the Middle East, with hundreds of attacks against US and Israeli targets in or from Syria, Iraq, Lebanon and Yemen by militias supported by Iran, which is an enemy of Israel and the United States. In Syria, pro-Iran militias attacked two United States military bases in the east of the country on Thursday, the NGO Syrian Observatory for Human Rights reported, without giving immediate details about victims or material damage. Photo: AFP In the West Bank, the other Palestinian territories, which are separated from Gaza by the Israeli State and occupied and colonized by Israel, more than 300 Palestinians have died in attacks by the Army or Israeli settlers since October 7. The highest authority of the UN on human rights, Volker TÃ¼rk, asked Israel this Thursday â€œend illegal killingsâ€ of Palestinians in the West Bank, in a report that denounces a rapid deterioration of the situation in the region. TÃ¼rk, UN High Commissioner for Human Rights, denounced â€œthe use of military tactics and weapons in law enforcement contexts, the use of unnecessary and disproportionate force and the application of broad, arbitrary and discriminatory movement restrictions affecting Palestiniansâ€ in the West Bank. â€œThe intensity of the violence and repression has not been seen for years,â€ he added. The latest ICF report warns that acute food insecurity puts the 335,000 children under five in the Gaza Strip at high risk of severe malnutrition and dying from preventable causes. â€” UNICEF in Spanish (@unicefenespanol) [December 27, 2023] For his part, the United Nations Childrenâ€™s Fund (UNICEF) He said Thursday that 2023 was â€œthe deadliest year for childrenâ€ in the West Bank and that â€œconflict-related violence has reached unprecedented levels.â€ â€œIn the last twelve weeks, 83 boys and girls have been murderedmore than double all boys and girls killed in all of 2022, amid an increase in military operations and police forcesâ€ by Israel, said UNICEF director for the Middle East and North Africa, Adele Khodr. â€œMore than 576 children have been injured and the arrest of some others has been reported,â€ he added. [#Gaza]: I call for an immediate end to the use of military weapons and means during Israeli law enforcement operations, an end to ill-treatment & discriminatory restrictions of Palestinians â€“ [@volker_turk]on the UN report on the human rights situation in the occupied West Bank â€” UN Human Rights (@UNHumanRights) [December 28, 2023] Mediation attempt Egypt this week presented a proposal to end the conflict that would include the release of all hostages held in Gaza and all Palestinians imprisoned in Israel, as well as the establishment of a government of Palestinian technocrats to administer Gaza and the West Bank until they can. elections be held. The plan received a cold reception from both sidesbut none rejected it outright. The head of Egyptâ€™s State Information Service, Dia Rashuan, said Thursday that the proposal was drawn up from the â€œpoints of viewâ€ of the parties involved, but that he had not yet received a response from them. #Israel #killed #dozens #Palestinians #Gaza #including #depopulated #north
